topics.body:
I know it's a bit of a derail, but my joking about being the borg made me realize something: the borg or a hivemind is a stupid fucking idea in science fiction.


What I mean by this is that immediate problems with hiveminds in science fiction: the individual units can't function without the whole.

A better idea for science fiction would be group that forcefully makes people into cyborgs and brainwashes them into enjoying it without overwriting their entire personality or such so that the person is working for your side instead.  Like rather than completely over-ride their mind instead every time they are loyal to the hive the pleasure center of their brain is stimulated or if they're a species that can't feel pleasure make a implant so that they can feel pleasure.

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552d931f6368722194441800#post_552d931f6368722194441800
[bq="QuasarNova"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552d92b36368723781f02000#post_552d92b36368723781f02000

I'll take that as a victory for the Geth[/bq]
The Geth would fucking wreck the Borg hard.

The Borg has a higher capability as a whole, but the Geth can function without needing to be actively working together.  Hypothetically if you were to severe the Borg's connections with each other they legitimately would be incapable of functioning.

That was actually a episode of Star Trek: the next generation where a child Borg was learning about humans and they had the opportunity to completely kill all the Borg because the Borg were physically incapable of severing their connections with each other.  One little paradox in the Borg's network would have killed every last one of the Borg.  Geth on the other hand would have just severed connection with the infected unit.

Geth:
Can function apart from others

Borg:
Can't physically severe connections with each other and one paradox would kill every last Borg in existence. . . kind of a big design flaw.

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552d94f36368721bc93e2000#post_552d94f36368721bc93e2000
[bq="QuasarNova"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552d94976368722d98f60100#post_552d94976368722d98f60100

Acknowledged[/bq]
What would happen if Geth vs Borg:

Geth, "I am telling a lie"
Borg:
!http://i2.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/300/361/093.gif!


The Borg have severe design flaws.  They can't function as single units; they can't sever connections with infected units; they can't cancel functions; they can't shut down illegal processes that are paradoxes; they *HAVE TO* process paradoxes until a resolution is concluded and so forth.  Those are severe design flaws.
